Class RocketPiece

  • java.lang.Object
    • RocketPiece

  • public class RocketPiece
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a single component of the drawn rocket.
    Version:
    May 25, 2016
    Author:
    Andrew Kou, Period: 3, APCS Final Project: LunarX, Sources: None

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RocketPiece(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Constructs the RocketPiece object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws the rocket piece as the rocket explodes.
      void resetCrashCoords()
      Resets the first and second X and Y coordinates so they can be set to a different rocket-terrain collision coordinate
      void setCrashCoords(int x, int y)
      Sets the first and second X and Y coordinates to the location where the rocket collides with the terrain.
      java.lang.String toStr()
      Returns a RocketPiece object in the form of a string, displaying information about its coordinates and its X and Y velocities.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RocketPiece

        public RocketPiece(int x1,
           int y1,
           int x2,
           int y2)
        Constructs the RocketPiece object. Assigns the x and y coordinate parameters to the corresponding coordinate fields, and assings random X and Y velocities that are not zero.
        Parameters:
        x1 - the first X coordinate of the linear rocket piece
        y1 - the first Y coordinate of the linear rocket piece
        x2 - the second X coordinate of the linear rocket piece
        y2 - the second Y coordinate of the linear rocket piece

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the rocket piece as the rocket explodes. The piece floats across the screen according to the X and Y velocities.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object

      • setCrashCoords

        public void setCrashCoords(int x,
                  int y)
        Sets the first and second X and Y coordinates to the location where the rocket collides with the terrain.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate of the collision of the rocket with the terrain
        y - the Y coordinate of the collision of the rocket with the terrain

      • resetCrashCoords

        public void resetCrashCoords()
        Resets the first and second X and Y coordinates so they can be set to a different rocket-terrain collision coordinate

      • toStr

        public java.lang.String toStr()
        Returns a RocketPiece object in the form of a string, displaying information about its coordinates and its X and Y velocities.
        Returns:
        the String corresponding to this RocketPiece
